intro: Calamintha epilosa, commonly known as narrowleaf catnip, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pale blue to violet and bloom in clusters during the summer months. Calamintha epilosa is often found in moist woodlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial to full shade.
